replies.msg:
Because a lot of people fail to understand the term 'global warning".
They mistaken that 'global warning' means the weather will be warmer every year.

replies.msg:
We have indeed talked about this in 1970s. So please do not think global cooling is crazy.

I also need to point out that some environmental protection people have overstated the danger of global warming. We have two extreme groups of people: one group deny global warming while the other group overstated the danger of global warming. When some people over-stated the danger of global warming, they created some fake information. Therefore, they are counter-productive in fighting the global warming.

My opinion is that global warming is real and we need to address this problem now because the earth is large and hence, it has a large inertia. It ill take more than a decade to see our effect on combating the global warming. On the other hand, global warming is NOT yet an end of world crisis. However, if we do not take action now, global warming will become an end of world crisis for the next generation.

replies.msg:
Flooding is always a major problem for most of countries. Our main problem is that most large cities are very near to sea level. The second problem is that they need both heaters (in winter) and air-conditioners (in summer). This is vrey headache problem for building electricity power plant. Large scale of storing electricity is still beyond our reach. The main difficulty of creating a electricity power plant is to predict the usage of electricity many years ahead.

Soviet Union has NOTt put a lot of effort into climate research after late 1960s because they knew that the answer is not always one sided.

Furthermore, the situation depends on our technology.

The US government wanted to know the consequence of global warming and it asked the best scientists in USA, these best scientists are not experts in climate, they gave the answer we know accepted. The US government did not like the answer, so the US government asked the opinion of the climate scientists. replies.msg:
We have a lot GCM model to prove this.

Actually these large complicated GCM (Global Climate Model or General Circulation Model) are not the best to prove this fact. The best model is simpler 1-D radiative model. In the mush more complicated GCM, the time step is usually 1 to 5 hour(s) and we need several months to finish the calculation using the computers.

Anyone who can tell you the simple radiative model is better than the very complicated GCM for the purpose of proving our emitted housegreen gases is the current reason for global warming, then you know he/she is an expert in climate research.

replies.msg:
I forgot to comment on your graph:
The scales for CO2 and CH4 are not the same in the graph.

The amount of CO2 in the atmosphere is always many times larger than CH4 so that CO2 is the dominant greenhouse gas. Actually, people have also talked about CH4 and hence, they want people to stop eating beef. In our computer models, we include include at least 6 greenhouse gases so we have studied the effects of other greenhouse gases.

One more thing: The older GCMs (say, 1980s) predicted a much warming earth because we did not have enough knowledge about aerosols. Most of the aerosols will cool down the earth. In the 1990s, we began to include aerosols in our computer models so that the earth will not warm up so quickly and our models agree with the observational data nicely.

Summing up, we have emitted greenhouse gases to warm up the earth and we have also emitted aerosols to cool down the earth. Various clean air acts reduced the amount of aerosols we emitted. So environment protection itself has also helped to make global warming worse!

Flooding is always a major problem for most of countries. Our main problem is that most large cities are very near to sea level. The second problem is that they need both heaters (in winter) and air-conditioners (in summer). This is vrey headache problem for building electricity power plant. Large scale of storing electricity is still beyond our reach. The main difficulty of creating a electricity power plant is to predict the usage of electricity many years ahead.

Soviet Union has NOTt put a lot of effort into climate research after late 1960s because they knew that the answer is not always one sided.

Furthermore, the situation depends on our technology.

The US government wanted to know the consequence of global warming and it asked the best scientists in USA, these best scientists are not experts in climate, they gave the answer we know accepted. The US government did not like the answer, so the US government asked the opinion of the climate scientists. James Hansen, former head of GISS (that is the boss of the scientists I given their email in an earlier reply) gave exactly the same conclusion to the US government. (GISS = Goddard Institute of Space Studies of NASA). The US government did not like it again. So, the US government asked the third opinion. The third opinion was that technology can overcome most of the drawbacks of global warming. Therefore, the US government was quite happy.

replies.msg:
Flooding will come long before the sea level raise above the cities. During bad weather, the sea level will rise a lot and the flooding will come suddenly and kill a lot of people. Furthermore, the melting of ice-sheet can create a lot of flooding in many parts of the country (even though some of these are high in altitude).

Also, don't understand the difficult of electricity supply. Just look at what happen in China now.

Rain distribution is also a problem that have not yet well understood. This is because one of worst predictions by GCMs is precipitation. Some parts of the country may have too much rain and hence, flooding; while the other parts do not have enough rain.

Global warming has a lot of advantages, but it also has a lot of drawback. If the warming is too fast for us to handle, it is certainly a crisis; if the warming is slow enough for us to handle, a lot (but not all) can enjoy the benefits.

replies.msg:
We HAVE isolate and test this day after day:

One of the computer run is fixing the greenhouse gases to the values of year 1850 or 1880. This is called the control run.
We then run a second simulation, we uses the amount of the greenhouse gases observed year by year since 1850 or 1888. The result of the second run agrees very well with the observed weather data for the past few decades. While the earth in the control run in much cooler. The only difference in these two computations is the amount of greenhouse gases.

This kind of calculation has been done since 1980s and we ALWAYS get the same answer: greenhouse gases are the cause of the recent warming.

On the other hand, wWe do not able to understand the very mild global cooling in 1950s and 1960s because aerosols may be the cause of that cooling and our data of areosols in the 1950s and 1960s are poor.

Summing up, we understand the true reason of global warming in the past 50 years, but we do not sure the reason of the global cooling in the 1950s and 1960s.

If you really want to give a prove for some argument you supported, instead of just saying some expert had proved this argument, you should provide the proof yourself. If someone(including you) support some arguments just because there are some experts support it, then the guy is not a "science" guy. He just imagines he is a "science" guy. You should remember this: science is not about the argument itself but is the construction of reasoning which to/against the argument.

ps: I don't really care whenever there is a climate change. I don't support/against climate change either. However, I do care how people construct their "knowledge base".

quote.msg:
CO2 is the main driving force, but it is not all the driving force.
The second important greenhouse gas is CH4. Actually CH4 is a few times more powerful than CO2 as a greenhouse gas.

However, if there are very significant changes in temperature, then a large change in CO2 is almost always the dominant force because the other factors do not change so much.

We all need is prove. Either it is a large scale simulation or similar arrangement

Co2 vs ch4 concentration is below. They are increased at same time in human history.

https://www.euanmearns.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/vostok_co2_methane.png

We have a lot GCM model to prove this.

Actually these large complicated GCM (Global Climate Model or General Circulation Model) are not the best to prove this fact. The best model is simpler 1-D radiative model. This is because in this simple one dimensional models, we can separate the atmosphere into many more layers and use a very small time step).

In the mush more complicated GCM, the time step is usually 1 to 5 hour(s) and we need several months to finish the calculation using the computers.

Anyone who can tell you the simple radiative model is better than the very complicated GCM for the purpose of proving our emitted housegreen gases is the current reason for global warming, then you know he/she is an expert in climate research.
